thread.title: Senior Legal Cashier

title: Senior Legal Cashier
text:
Job Ref: J95400 
A top 20 Law firmis looking for a Senior Legal Cashier to head up a team of two legal cashiers, reporting directly to the Chief Cashier. Your primary responsibility will be organising the daily client transactions and ensuring receipts and payments are processed in line with our internal policies to maintain compliance with Solicitors Accounts Rules, AML requirements and any other necessary legislation. You will also complete the bank reconciliations, and review and release transactions prepared by other members of the team. The role will also involve a strong interface with the firm's fee earners and secretaries to address client queries and monitor client balances, sometimes under time pressure. This will include liaising with senior members and partners of the firm. You will be proficient in dealing with all aspects of client account cashiering and ensure that there is consistent adherence to the Solicitors Accounts Rules. You will exercise a high standard of professional judgement and provide technically sound responses to queries raised to maintain a high quality of client service. Responsibilities: • Dealing with Nat West Bankline download for bank statement transfer • Regular downloads from NatWest for monies received into our accounts • Enter/release payments (foreign/ sterling) and IATs • Prepare and update the diary for designated deposit and pooled client funds • Placing of deposits online (money market, general client overnight / fixed term) • Prepare/post client receipts and payments • Prepare/post client deposits and client to client transfers • Interest calculations (system generated and manual) • Prepare/post client to office/office to client transfers • Bank charges recharging • Preparing and reconciling month end / daily bank reconciliations • Dealing with Joint Accounts • Checking letters and statements received from the banks • Dealing with client queries and issues presented by Fee Earners/Secretaries • Liaising with the bank on Client Account matters • Dealing with the daily cash flow and other ad hoc analysis Experience needed: • Strong attention to detail • Demonstrates experience dealing with SARs and AML legislation, together with an understanding of legal accounting principles and practices. • Knowledge of online banking systems • Ability to work to deadlines and deliver under pressure • Good team working skills • Detailed knowledge of Excel 
Morgan Hunt is a multi award winning Employment Business for interim, contract and temporary recruitment and acts as an Employment Agency in relation to permanent vacancies. Morgan Hunt is an equal opportunities employer.
